Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.service.impl

Class TransactionServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.service.impl.base.AbstractCrudService<TransactionRepository,Transaction,Long>
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.service.impl.TransactionServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICrudService<Transaction,Long>, ITransactionService
public final class TransactionServiceImpl extends AbstractCrudService<TransactionRepository,Transaction,Long> implements ITransactionService
Transaction service (no Tag handling here). It are the concrete impl that deal with creating and listing transactions using a repository. Tries to be small and a bit boring by desing so behaviour stay predictable and not surprise users/devs.

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionServiceImpl

      public TransactionServiceImpl()
      Build the service wiring a fresh TransactionRepository. Nothing fancy happen: we just compose and go do our jobs.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public Transaction add(TransactionCreate dto)
      Create and persist a new Transaction from the provided DTO. The DTO should be already validated/trimmed elsewhere; here we resolve the category, map fields and save. If category id is wrong we throw, because silent failing are bad.
      Specified by:
      add in interface ITransactionService
      Parameters:
      dto - compact input data; must not be null or things goes wierd later
      Returns:
      the persisted transaction instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the category cannot be found

    • list

      public List<Transaction> list(TxFilter filter)
      List transactions matching the given filter. Convenience overload that default the mode to FilterMode.ALL. If filter has null fields they mean “no constraint”. Order depends on repository behaviour.
      Specified by:
      list in interface ITransactionService
      Parameters:
      filter - criteria object; can be null fields inside
      Returns:
      list of matching transactions (maybe empty)

    • list

      public List<Transaction> list(TxFilter filter, FilterMode mode)
      List transactions matching both a filter and a mode relative to “today”. If mode is null we treat it as FilterMode.ALL. The “today” value comes from LocalDate.now() which is good enough in most cases.
      Specified by:
      list in interface ITransactionService
      Parameters:
      filter - criteria describing from/to/type/category (null fields means none)
      mode - how to include/exclude by date (ALL/PAST/FUTURE); may be null
      Returns:
      matching transactions in repo-defined order
